conclusion: A triangle that has all its sides equal is equilateral, [1d15] so ABC is equilateral.

steps.text: Let the given line be AB.
With center A and radius AB, draw circle BCD. [p3]
With center B and radius BA, draw circle ACE and call one of the points where they intersect C [p3]
Because AC and AB are radii of the same circle, BCD, they must be equal. [1d15]
Things which are equal to the same thing are also equal to each other [a1], so all three lines AB, AC, CB, are equal.
